When people say "kite Tryndamere" they don't mean "kite Tryndamere in a 1v1".

In fact, very rarely does anyone say "kite x" and mean to do so in a 1v1. Very few ADCs can kite Nasus for example in a 1v1, but kiting is one of Nasus' main weakness.

You kite them in team fights. Tryndamere has to either E or flash to get on your ADC, so once it's used any hard CC stops his ability to dive, allowing your team to force his ult out. And while he's being peeled so you can kite him his ult duration is being wasted, meaning he probably is going to have to try to disengage or die.

This is why Tryndamere is bad at team fighting.

This is why rushing a big AD item like Bloodthirster is stupid. You're spending 3,700 gold on a bunch of AD (without any attack speed to make good use of it, and without having enough bonus AD scaling for that to not matter), a shield (on a champion whose ult lets them not die and is already almost unbeatable 1v1), and a lot of lifesteal, which you won't proc as often because, once again, shit-tier attack speed (and is honestly made redundant by your Q heal). By contrast, for 1,100 less gold you get more crit (up to 65% if your passive is at max), a good amount of attack speed, movement speed for chasing, waveclear, and burst damage on your first auto attack.

Bloodthirster is an incredibly inefficient rush on Tryndamere. You aren't making good use of the stats.  Shiv is a big power spike at a much lower cost. For the price of bloodthirster, you can get shiv and a caulfield's warhammer, or shiv, ionian's, and a dagger. This will give you much higher DPS than Bloodthirster alone would. 

Also, your hatred of botrk is silly. Tryndamere was one of the only good users of it, and now that it was buffed it's better on him. Tryndamere is, at his core, a duelist. He duels people. Blade of the Ruined King is the best lifesteal item for dueling people. The lifesteal is nice (especially since you have attack speed with it), it gives some AD, a good amount of attack speed (once again attack speed is important because you have no attack speed steroids in your kit), on-hit damage, and the active is extremely important for chasing people down. This build is really all about making Tryndamere very hard to escape.

Going over the crit cap isn't particularly important, especially when Tryndamere doesn't get crit chance all the time with his passive like Yasuo does. Having higher crit gives you more consistent DPS throughout the entire fight, and being able to reach 100% at all (as opposed to your shitty build which never would).

Trynd main here. I've got over five thousand games on Tryndamere across all seasons.

I never asked for Tryndamere to be relegated to split pushing in season 2, but thats what happened. In season 1 before he was reworked to use fury he was actually really good in team fights. Ever since they removed his bonus crit damage, nerfed his ult duration, max healing, and his spin range, he's been forced to split push.

At this point there is so much CC and mobility in the game, even if RIOT were to revert Tryndamere largely to his old kit, it wouldn't make him any better in a team fight.

The problem with Tryndamere is that he tries to do too many things. He wants to be immune to death, pump out ridiculous damage and be super sticky all at the same time. Its too much.

"Guy with a person-sized sword" doesn't scream "mobility / stickiness". If it were up to me I'd take away Tryndamere's stickiness (mocking shout and nerf spin cooldown), and replace it with something that would allow him to exist in team fights.

Trynd doesn't need stickiness to play the game, because if he had that (and enough of everything else), he would just be broken. If he has that and doesn't have enough of everything else to team fight, he will just split push all day and thats just boring. What he needs is some ways to de-aggro. Undying rage is a fantastic de-aggro tool, but it isn't wise to force Trynd to have all his eggs in that one basket because it makes him too binary. It makes it impossible for him to fail without dying, or to win without stomping.

So he needs something like a sword block. Something that makes the enemy backline / frontline think twice about putting focus fire on Trynd, similar to how windwall functions for yasuo.

I'm thinking maybe like a channeled block that makes Trynd immune to any cc and damage originating from 180 degrees in front of him, but prevents him from moving, turning, attacking, or using spells or items while it is channeling.

I'm not saying thats the only way to fix his problems, but its in the right direction. He needs less stickiness and more functionality. He shouldn't be afraid of a big fight, and in order to realize that in his gameplay you have to make him EFFECTIVE in a big fight, otherwise he will never be there-- a smart Trynd player would just avoid confrontation at all costs and split push all day.

Here is thread I made on the overall ideas I have for Trynd if you are interested: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/Vr4sFriN-make-tryndamere-more-like-a-barbarian-warrior-with-a-huge-sword-and-less-of-a-saboteur-or-bandit
